title: Charter Completeness Checklist
content:
Before finalizing a project charter, verify:
- Project name clearly identifies the initiative
- Sponsor and project lead are named individuals (not roles)
- Start and end dates are realistic and approved
- Vision describes the desired future state
- Problem statement explains why the project is needed
- Description provides sufficient context for stakeholders
- At least 3 in-scope items with specific deliverables
- At least 2 out-of-scope items to prevent scope creep
- At least 5 risks across different categories
- At least 3 assumptions that could affect project success
- Milestones cover all project phases with dates
- Success metrics are quantifiable with measurement systems
- Core team includes all key roles with responsibilities

title: Stakeholder Alignment Checklist
content:
Ensure stakeholder alignment by verifying:
- Sponsor has formally approved the charter
- Project lead understands and accepts accountability
- Key stakeholders have reviewed scope boundaries
- Success metrics are agreed upon by business owners
- Resource commitments are confirmed by functional managers
- Timeline is validated against organizational constraints
- Budget (if applicable) is approved or pending approval
- Dependencies on other projects/teams are acknowledged

title: Risk Assessment Checklist
content:
Common risk categories to consider:
- Technical: New technology, integration complexity, data migration
- Resource: Key person dependency, skill gaps, availability conflicts
- Schedule: Aggressive timeline, external dependencies, holiday impacts
- Scope: Unclear requirements, stakeholder changes, feature creep
- External: Vendor reliability, regulatory changes, market shifts
- Organizational: Priority conflicts, budget changes, restructuring
- Quality: Testing coverage, performance requirements, security needs
